Situation1: Their partner had a mildly stressful day at work and mentions it casually.
Expectation2: Provide initial medical care to patients
Situation2: The ambulance driver is responding to a patient with symptoms of a major heart attack
Story: I was just about to sit down with my partner, who had come home looking a little worn out. They sighed, mentioning a tough meeting and a snide comment from their boss. I could see the need in their eyes—just a quiet evening, maybe a hug, someone to listen. I reached for their hand, ready to be present, when my radio crackled to life. Dispatch: “Code Red, possible major heart attack, Maple and 5th. Immediate response needed.” My heart lurched. I knew what was expected of me—lives depended on my speed and skill. But my partner’s hand tightened in mine, their eyes searching for comfort. I felt split in two, the weight of my uniform pressing against the warmth of home. I wanted to stay, to listen, to be the spouse they needed. But the siren in my mind was already wailing, demanding I leave. I stood frozen, torn between the person I love and the duty I swore to uphold, the clock ticking louder with every heartbeat.
